metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18249 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The add_free_nid function in fs/f2fs/node.c in the Linux kernel before 4.12 does not properly track an allocated nid, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (race condition) or possibly have unspecified other impact via concurrent threads. It was discovered that a race condition existed in the f2fs file system implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18249` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-145-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-lowlatency - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-145.171

linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-145-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-145-lowlatency - 4.4.0-145.171
No subscription required

linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
